Package harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib

Class TSimpleLogger

java.lang.Object
harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TSimpleLogger
All Implemented Interfaces:
ILogger
public class TSimpleLogger
extends java.lang.Object
implements ILogger
TSimpleLogger is a quite simple class helping to manage the important task of take trace (that is, log) of actions made by all maior TombolaLib methods. I know I could have chosen to use many beautiful, complex, logger solutions and packages already available for Java, but I preferred to reduce to the minimum external dependencies and keep things as simple as possible. Main principles to use this class and its objects follows:
  • Each library user can prepare his own logger objects using one of the overloaded static prepareLogger(java.lang.String, harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.ILogger.TLogLevel, java.io.PrintStream) method available. Each log object will be registered with a symbolic name and this name will allow one or more objects within a program to use and send messages to the same logger. Static method getLoggerByName(String) is here to serve in this way. That's it, simple.
  • Standard, default, simple logger have been already provided with no need to pass through the prepareLogger(java.lang.String, harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.ILogger.TLogLevel, java.io.PrintStream) phase. They have standard names also stored in public final strings:
    • A default logger used by ISetFactory objects to log series generation events
    • A default logger used by TGame objects to log tombola match related events
    • a generic logger that simply put messages on standard output stream
    • a generic logger that simply put messages on standard error stream
    • a generic logger that simply discard received messages as the mythical /dev/null destination
Since:
1.8
Version:
1.1
Author:
Harry G. Potter (harry.g.potter@]mail.com)

    • setLevel

      public void setLevel​(ILogger.TLogLevel level)
      Change the level for this logger objects: only messages with a TLogLevel higher or equal to the TLogLevel of the logger will be written/traced.
      Specified by:
      setLevel in interface ILogger
      Parameters:
      level - the new level to set for this logger object, expressed using the TLogLevel enum type.

    • log

      public void log​(ILogger.TLogLevel msgLevel, java.lang.String message)
      Send the message string to the logger using the specified level of attention. The message will be traced only if the log level of the logger is higher or equal to the log level of the message.
      Specified by:
      log in interface ILogger
      Parameters:
      msgLevel - The level of attention you want to use for this specific message.
      message - The text message you want to log.

    • getLoggerByName

      public static TSimpleLogger getLoggerByName​(java.lang.String name)
      Allows for client class to retrieve a TLogger instance using a descriptive name as identifier, so that many classes can easily share the same log instance within an application.
      Parameters:
      name - The name that uniquely identify the logger object
      Returns:
      the TLogger object to use to log events and messages if the logger has been previously prepared and exists, null otherwise.

    • prepareLogger

      public static void prepareLogger​(java.lang.String logName, ILogger.TLogLevel level, java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Use this method to prepare a new logger object that can be used by all other TombolaLib major protagonists, such as ISetFactory or TGame objects.
      Parameters:
      logName - the name to uniquely identify the logger object
      level - the initial level of message upon which log messages are effectively traced
      filename - the text filename where log messages will be spooled to
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - is for some reason it will not be possible to open the filename passed as argument.

    • prepareLogger

      public static void prepareLogger​(java.lang.String logName, ILogger.TLogLevel level, java.io.PrintStream stream)
      Use this method to prepare a new logger object that can be used by all other TombolaLib major protagonists, such as ISetFactory or TGame objects.
      Parameters:
      logName - the name to uniquely identify the logger object
      level - the initial level of message upon which log messages are effectively traced
      stream - the PrintStream object where log messages will be spooled to (it can be System.out or System.err as well).

    • setTimeStampFormat

      public void setTimeStampFormat​(java.lang.String format)
      Allows the change of the format used to print the timestamp at the beginning of each log message.
      Parameters:
      format - the String specifying the timestamp format to use, following the well known convention of Java DateTimeFormatter objects.
